headline.main: FRENCH EXPENSE INCREASES MONEY; State Puts New Funds Into Circulation Without Raising Them by Taxes DANGERS IN THE SITUATION But So Far Exaggerated Price Rises and Depreciation Have Been Avoided

lead_paragraph: VICHY, France, Feb. 2 -- Interest rates on defense bonds which were reduced recently from 4 to 3 1/2 per cent, have been lowered again to 3.25 per cent. Treasury bonds, on the other hand, have been cut, for the one-year issues, from 3 to 2.75 per cent and for the six-month issues, from 2.50 to 2.25 per cent.
abstract: Govt cuts interest rate on defense bonds
